qas.question: What year did Thomas R. Steels propose the single body union branch?
Where was Thomas R. Steels a member?
WHere was the proposed conference held?
Who proposed a special conference to bring all right-wing organisations together?
What group did not pass the motion?
Where was the conference help before 1900?
What was attended by only a narrow spectrum of organizations?
What represented two thirds of the TUC delegates?

context: In <a0_0>1899<a0_0/>, a <a1_0>Doncaster<a1_0/> member of the Amalgamated Society of Railway Servants, <b3_0>Thomas R. Steels<b3_0/>, proposed in his union branch that the Trade Union Congress call a special conference to bring together all left-wing organisations and form them into a single body that would sponsor Parliamentary candidates. The motion was passed at all stages by the <b4_0>TUC<b4_0/>, and the proposed conference was held at the <a2_0><b5_0>Memorial Hall<a2_0/> on Farringdon Street<b5_0/> on 26 and 27 February 1900. The <b6_0>meeting<b6_0/> was attended by a broad spectrum of working-class and left-wing organisations — <b7_0>trades unions<b7_0/> represented about one third of the membership of the TUC delegates.
